reviews_data.review_text: Lost & found >

Best thing about this place is the coffee and tacos. Other than that, overpriced drinks and always a long line. Heavy ego'd crowd on the weekend nights, I thin kI stopped like three fights by simply pretending to know the potential victim & apologizing. (I'm a taller bigger guy and tend to look like security lol) still don't know all the hype around this place but probably will only get coffee if I'm around.

Staff was great! You could see owner and management active and engaging which really showed in the service provided. The brunch fries were incredible! The chorizo sandwich was refreshingly light. Chips and queso were good. Drinks left a lot to be desired. Great atmosphere!
It's a great atmosphere.
Club vibe, not a brewery vibe. Great spot though, and the best beer at a "club" you're going to get in Charlotte.
It's set up with a bar and fast casual dining with a great atmosphere. The food and drinks are good.
This place gives incredible attention to detail in every aspect of their food and coffee. Easily some of the best coffee I've ever had.

I like the original brewery in plaza but the south end location is disappointing. Cocktail and wine selection is almost non-existent, and the ones you can get just don't taste good and don't nearly stand up to their price tags. The popularity of the brewery speaks to the fact that it's "trendiness" that bars in the Charlotte area strive for, over quality and creativity.
Good beer and lots of seats.  Service could have been a little faster, bartender was missing for 5 to 6 minutes at a time filing something off to the side. I would recommend all in all
Good times but $14.29 (without tip) for a small Tito's and soda was way too much. We're not in Miami.
Pretty good, high on flavor and texture, low on portion. Coffee is good.  I'd eat it again, but I hope they add a larger breakfast burrito to the lineup.
The coffee is indeed killer. The breakfast tacos are amazing. Come in for coffee and a taco and stay for the great space to work in.
Second stop for the night and it was a cool vibe with great people to hang out with.
It's a brewery...wait for it...and a nightclub. Prepare to be searched if you go while it's busy. They got liquor.
Had an amazing time! Love the location and hanging out at the bar. Pang was so attentive to our needs and made sure we were well taken care of!

Review for killer coffee:  Sublime coffee shop located inside resident culture. Great coffee and tacos to enjoy before it's time to have a beer.  I ordered a latte and a chorizo taco. It's pretty popular here, so the wait was longer than I had expected, but once they arrived, it was top notch all the way around. The latte was smooth with a slightly bitter kick, just the way I like. The taco was a good size for the price, and the chorizo, while a bit greasy, was popping with flavor and blended well with the egg and cheese, and the tortilla was quite enjoyable as well.  Definitely a good place to stop for coffee in south end!

Bonus coffee bar in the back! Come during the day for some chill vibes and free wifi.  This is my go-to spot for a mobile workspace; order up a velvety coffee, from scratch breakfast burrito, and set up in the open, plant-filled atmosphere.  There's even a unique vending machine with quirky trinkets and local art!  I'm definitely coming back again, it's a well executed breakfast workplace.

The beer is incredible but I recently found out they have breakfast and coffee, KILLER COFFEE, and it has now become my regular coffee/remote work spot. Tons of seating in the taproom and free wifi.  The dirty horchata with a chorizo breakfast taco is always the move! Love having a solid coffee spot near my office in South End that isn't a sit down restaurant!
Coffee and tacos are great.
Nice spot to grab some coffee and get work done. Lots of seating as well.
Love getting my coffee and breakfast from here. Everyone is super polite and welcoming. Have yet to get anything bad on the menu. Highly recommend to anyone who loves coffee and good food.
The door was locked at 9 pm despite their posted hours are 10 pm. I was told we ‚Äúsnuck in‚Äù when I entered at 9. Not true to their posted hours and bad quality of service
Love this place! Friendly convenient table service, great beer (and cocktails!) and excellent casual Mexican tapas and taco options.
Food is above average

Great tacos! Its not people friendly due to ordering from QR code. Would rate more if had the option to order from a person to ask questions about the food and beer. Beer menu was there via lcd screen prior to ordering via online. Good for the local who knows the place! First timer not so friendly!
Always have you double check my tab here
Barbacoa breakfast tacos are the best and great toast.

Breakfast menu is amazing. Breakfast tacos, waffles and the mushroom toast were all very flavorful. Great coffee and espresso drinks. Staff is super attentive and friendly. We were on a tight schedule and the staff was helpful in getting our food fast and then helping us wrap up. We will definitely be back.

Good variety of drinks, and had a great time at the drag brunch. Could use better integration of thier food, and maybe look at better outside tables. The ones they have are a bit uncomfortable. But otherwise, a pretty great place.
Bouncers are super sensitive and will kick you out if you tell them their breath stinks.
Great music!!
Staff was super attentive at the bar and beer was good. Ordered Chips and guac and it hit the spot!

Resident Culture is one of my absolute favorite places in Charlotte. If you like great beer, Tacos, and a wonderful time, this is the place for you. The tap selection is always incredible, they go above and beyond to make sure there is a beer on tap for everyone. If you happen to not be a beer fan, they have some great options for mixed drinks as well.

The new DJ on Saturday nights is not very good. She kept playing old school hip hop over and over again. I don't come to this place to listen to ‚Äúwalk it like I talk it‚Äù Friends also will not be back until they change the songs and vibe.
Boring music
I really like this place! Super cool vibes, good beer (try the sour) and their glasses are the cutest!

Went last night (a Friday), prior to the drinking crowd. Got there around 830ish. Apparently they stop serving food at 8, but the bartender sympathized and let me order anyway ‚Äî I guess because it was pretty slow. (Thanks again)  Al Pastor tacos were DELICIOUS. Chips and queso wasn't bad, but the chips were definitely over salted.  Vibe was cool, beer was good, made some new friends. Had a great time. Probably about 10 it started picking up and by 11 there was a line out the door.  <>  Also been here once before with the drinking crowd and it was alright. Certainly a crowded place, but I found I prefer coming here when it isn't super loud. It's a good ‚Äúpregame‚Äù place for me.

Obsessed with this place for breakfast, brunch and lunch. Amazing coffee, killer breakfast and regular tacos, great queso, gauc and salsa, AND delicious beer and cocktails. Everything is ready within minutes.  We always bring our dog and baby and sit outside, no wait in the weekends, and everyone is so nice.  Can't be beat!
Lots of space and chill atmosphere.  Great coffee and some good breakfast food in the morning.  Parking is hard to find.

We had our Rehearsal Dinner at RC, and we couldn't asked for a more fun and well put together event, and an excellent time was had by all of our guests!  The beer and food (from El Toro Bruto) were excellent, and the wait staff were always on hand making sure guests never had an empty glass! The planning was straightforward and low stress thanks to our coordinator, Emily. Pricing was clear and up front, while at the same time, we had tremendous flexibility in putting together a food and beverage package that worked for us. We couldn't recommend it more!

Clever ordering system that uses a QR on the table and you purchase your food and drinks in an app. Then it gets delivered to your table. I had delicious Al Pastor tacos and some tasty Kombucha. I'm not a beer drinker but there was a good selection of different ales and layers

Disappointing really. Went to RC recently with a big group and was not impressed at all. Being a regular at reputable places around Charlotte, I expected a higher level of personalized customer service than what RC had to offer. The door staff treats patrons as if they are TSA and will find any reason to deny entry. While my friends and I made it in without issues, many other prospective patrons did not. Once inside, you enter the land of try hards and ballers on a budget. Cocktails are about as good as one could make themselves and their liquor selection was nonexistent. The only reason this place got 2 instead of 1 star is because the bartender was very friendly. Don't come here. Don't waste your money. South end has so much more to offer and RC is definitely the bottom tier.

RC is somewhat the new guy on the block. Loud and fun dance music consistently. Pretty decent DJs and sound system in there. Long lines are the biggest problem they have after 9:30. Entry line, bar line, and women's restroom line can all take well over 20 mins depending on the foot traffic. That and slightly pricy drinks are enough to make me hesitate running back there. Overall I enjoy my time and I'm glad it's moved to South End.  Music & Atmosphere 5/5 Restroom access 3/5 Bar access 2/5 (after 10pm)

By far my favorite brewery in Southend! Excellent beers on tap, and a full bar for non beer lovers. Amazing tacos if you're hungry, and an almost nightclub feeling after dark. Definitely great place to hang out and be social!
The ordering situation is really weird.

Went in to listen to the Girls Room DJs and have a drink on Sunday and was treated rudely and nearly assaulted by the staff. Was yelled and cursed at by the bartender because he couldn't understand my simple drink order over the loud music. When I refused to leave a tip, the bartender dumped out my drinks without refunding my money. He then aggressively escorted me out. It felt like I would have been assaulted if I had given any resistance or tried to get the credit card charge refunded.  Please don't mistake this as a Resident Culture taproom. It's basically a club - a la Lost and Found - with some beer taps and food. Which honestly I expected, but I did NOT expect to get treated that way.
Great beer and great tacos.  The taco Tuesday deals is amazing.   Any beer and two tacos for $10.
super photogenic venue- however never tends to get filled up like the other bars/ clubs surrounding it. this place is just more of a chill bar spot

Security was absolutely terrible, I'm writing a Google review but feel like I should be writing a police statement. Watched a security guard Slam a young girl on the ground like a rag doll.  It was horrendous, unjustifiable actions I witnessed. He looked satisfied from his Sadistic actions. Can't believe what happened, watched this poor girl limp away confussed as I was why someone would do this. Highly recommend staying away from this place.

Worst people ever. This place is garbage. The security literally just grabbed my friend and threw my friend away because she was blocking a way? What type of person treat a woman like that way? My friend twisted her ankle because of this security guy, he was black and had dread hair. He needs to learn how to treat people right. He deserves to be in jail for throwing A GIRL on a street. Now my friend is on crutches. If you are a manager to this restaurant, start training your securities. This is beyond absurd and we will press charges.

I wish I could leave 0. We were here this past weekend for a bachelorette party and were making our way out to leave and stopped for a brief moment to pet a dog that was in the bar and security came up and was like you need to move you're blocking the walkway, we went on to apologize and leave and one of the security guards picked my friend up from her shoulders and ran her outside and threw her on the sidewalk. She now can't walk and is on crutches. I would love for the manager to contact us. This is unlawful and horrible behavior!

The security has a lack of communication and tries to start arguments in order to kick the guys out that came in with a group. Our group tried to move a table and we were told that we had to speak with management. Before we could walk away a male from our group was grabbed and yelled at for moving the table. The security escalated a small situation to a much larger situation and continued to try to kick the males from our group out. I do not recommend going here with a group as security will target males in order to keep the male to guy ratio. Management agreed to let us move the table but the security team is way to aggressive to ever have a group go to Residence Culture.
Really fun atmosphere! The beer and cocktail options are awesome. The food is amazing and very happy with the different size options. One of my favorite  places I've been to in Charlotte.

Okay, the ordering system is the best!  Scan a QR code, choose what you want and everything magically appears a moment later. The staff are nice, the food is good, but why hasn't every restaurant implemented this technology???

From my experience the employees are NOT friendly at all in South End and I was not impressed whatsoever. The one in Plaza Midwood is way better. The beer is reasonably priced and really good! If you're gonna go to this place I HIGHLY suggest going to the Plaza location. 5 stars for other location though.

Drinks were lousy. You're paying for the cool location and being around 21-26 year olds. Went for Cinco De Mayo and was severely disappointed. I've had better margaritas at Chili's. They honestly liked sugar water with cheap tequila. Will not be coming back anytime soon
The staff was so amazing. The beer was epic. Definitely worth the drive
Great atmosphere on Friday and Saturday nights. Line to get in takes a long time, same with getting a drink

Wouldn't let my friends and coworkers come in even though they were literally 2 minutes behind me because apparently they don't let anyone in past a certain time. By this time we had bought shots and drinks for the rest of the group and had to give half of them away. Won't be spending my money here again.

I see this more as a destination/entertainment brewery. No flights available but at the slow time I was allowed to taste several beers.  Smallest pour was about 9 oz.  Friendly staff but I could see this place packed on a weekend that might dampen or enhance your experience.   The beers were tasty.
Shut the doors at 1:30am last night and pushed everyone out.  Close at 11:00 like most breweries if you can't handle the crowd till 2am.
Beer was ok, queso was horrible.
Love the beer. The location is great with plenty of space and picnic tables in the alley. Will definitely come back to this location!
Extremely popular place among locals. Loud music and usually overcrowded. It feels like it is a club rather than a brewery.
Great beers quick service sitting at the bar.
Very nicely done remodel of an old industrial shop for the South End location of this brewery. Open space plus outdoor areas too. Of course, the beers are the stars of the show here.

This new building is a wonderful addition to the Charlotte Resident Culture collection and fits well into the S Mint Str area. It has a very vibrant energetic aesthetic and the crowd was hopin' even on midweek. Nice wide selection of drafts and, uncommon for a brewery taproom, there is tasty southwestern street taco and burrito selections available on-site. I'd highly recommend checking this place out.
Resident cultures 2nd location.. great beer, serves liquor, big space, outside patio. Good service will be back
Cool taproom. As always best local beer in town. Outdoor seating. Dj booth!

Beer is okay at best, but the service is weirdly aggressive. No host will actually seat you but they will not hesitate to yell at you if you are in their way. The guy patrolling the corridor from the useless hostess stand to the back to the bar is the rudest server I've encountered in south end in 5 years. Told us to move 5 feet away and then told us that wasn't where he wanted us to go üôÑ boy make up your mind??

I threw an event for my husband's birthday at RC South End, and I have nothing but wonderful things to say. 1. First off, the Event Manager Emily Cole is a dream to work with. She was so accommodating and was present the entire day for any questions or requests. We also had to reschedule last minute due to Covid, and she helped us reschedule with ease. 2. The new space is also BEAUTIFUL and lively and fun. We booked the private room, which was spacious and had a ton of natural light. They had a really cool drink ordering system that brought us drinks so we didn't have to wait in line at the bar. 3. Drinks and food were great. This isn't shocking coming from Resident Culture. 4. There's a beautiful event space coming downstairs for any brides looking to get married in South End!  Looking forward to making this a regular spot. We will definitely look to book another event there soon. Thank you Emily and Resident Culture!
Aahhmazing! Best staff, food, drinks are amazing. Doesnt get better!
The food and drinks were great, the atmosphere is very lively, and the service was the fastest service I have ever had!!
Very good beers. Not much vegetarian or vegan options for tacos. I had Napoles tacos and those were really good. It gets messy but they have me extra tortilla to make another taco with it.

Resident Culture just recently opened. So fairly new spot but the atmosphere on a Saturday night is amazing. Everyone is having a good time dancing , drinking , socializing, eating tacos( Toro buto) or all of the above. Also, they have a movable POS which is nice for processing customers fast.  You have to be 21+ to get in (at night) . There's enough room for everyone. They have tables on the main floor , at the back of the main floor and outdoor sitting too. Going to the restroom, they have a Disco ball spinning that's pretty cool. The DJ is on point with the music selection . Menu of their drinks on the TV. I'll say it like a mini optimist Hall but without the multiple food outlets. Overall, great experience. It's a spot to chill let loose with great friends.
Atmosphere was really cool. DJ was hot and the tacos were really fresh!
Cool new spot! Tasty beer, and nice crew! No onsite parking, but area is walkable.
Great vibes and atmosphere, delicious beer and outstanding tacos. I recommend the carne asada.

It's ironic the location of this Taco Shop is on Bland Street, because that is precisely how I would describe the tacos and chips/queso we ordered.  This place will do great in Southend given the generally basic tastes of the clientele.

Resident Culture pulls it off. Well adapted for the south end crowd. And while I'll be at the plaza location much more often due to proximity, this south end spot is incredible. Great tacos, even better Brutos- can't wait for Mostra.  Is it busy? Yes. But it's south end, so expect it and get over it. I went on opening weekend and had fantastic service, beer and cocktails were on point.  Congrats to everyone involved in opening a very cool spot.
Better places to hang in the South End. Do not recommend. Other Resident Culture location better way more laid back.

Loved the tacos. I tried the Nopal taco (10/10). The cocktails were great. Awesome atmosphere and the service was super sweet. They were a little behind at the grand opening but it was expected. A lot of people have been waiting for the opening so its understandable that the line was long. I was hyped to go and I wasn't disappointed. The scan to pay for your order is a great idea because when you are finished, you close your tab and leave. Overall, 10/10

Great place. Amazing food. Quality service. Some reviews say that the wait was long but that's normal at a grand opening. I love how convenient it was to order tacos from El Toro Bruto by just scanning the QR code and keeping the tab open. Excellent experience!

I went to the grand opening, and will give this place a grain of salt. There was a line out the door, about a 30 minute wait. When we were able to go in, it was quite busy inside with not enough seating. However the decorations are quite modern and colorful.  The taco place was hard to find as there isn't obvious signage and there is no physical place to order. You have to order through their website/QR code. They text you when your order is ready, but it wasn't obvious, so I thought I might have missed my order. It took about 40 minutes to receive my food after ordering. The tacos are really really good though. They're about $3.50 each and are just solid street tacos.  The wait for the beer wasn't too bad, but I did see long lines later in the night. There's one main bar and a smaller bar towards the back. I ordered a Mexican lager and it was pretty good standard beer.  We luckily found a table, but I experienced sensory overload. There was a lot of people, but the acoustics of the place amplified the sound. The colorful decorations could also be much after a while. I recommend going when it is not busy if you are sensitive to loud sounds and colors/lights. The wait staff was attentive and the place itself was clean.  Overall, a nice addition to the breweries in South end!
3 stars because I'm not from here but came for $1 tacos grand opening and churros waited in multiple lines and they were not $1. But not going to lie this $12 cockatiel I got was so good.
